page.title: 08Farming at New House
page.content: In order to{market}the crops prospective buyers come to examine their quality and eventually agree on a price. It is then taken away by a bulk carrier and Mr Boffey sells the straw. Some{stubble}is burnt for potash then ploughing and preparation for next year's crop starts all over again. Mr Boffey has to spend one day every week on{administration}but he enjoys his life on his farm. He has built a swimming-pool where he and his family like to entertain friends for a swim followed by a barbecue during their {recreation}time.
